title.title: Sarvaṅkaṣā vyākhyā of Mallinātha on the Śiśupālavadha of Māgha (sargas- 11-14) and Commentaries on Dayāśataka, Raṅgastuti, and Hayagrīvastotra of Vedāntadeśika

repository.orgName: Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary:
This mansucript has four texts. 1. Sarvaṅkaṣā vyākhyā of Mallinātha on the Śiśupālavadha of Māgha (sargas- 11-14) and then Commentaries on Dayāśataka, Raṅgastuti, and Hayagrīvastotra of Vedāntadeśika.
Sarvaṅkaṣā vyākhyā of Mallinātha on the Śiśupālavadha of Māgha is not complete. It stopts in the middle of the commentary on the last verse of the 14th Sarga of the Śiśupālavadha. The rest of the texts are complete. On in the left margin is written itītitthaṃ giraḥ prīyatamā iva which is a line from the vyākhyā of verse of Śiśupālavadha (5th Sarga 8th verse.)
śrīramajaryyaḥ is written on the recto of the first blank folio in Grantha.

msItem.title: Sarvaṅkaṣā vyākhyā of Mallinātha on the Śiśupālavadha of Māgha (sargas- 11-14)
msItem.author: Mallinātha
msItem.incipit:
1r
atha prastutāṃ prabhātavarṇanamārabhate śrutīti nāsti kakuryasyetyakākuravikṛtadhvaniḥ kāku striyāṃ vikāro yaśśokabhityābhirdhvanerityamaraḥ śrāvayatīti śrāvako 1r
dūradhvaniḥ snigdho madhuraśca kaṇṭhasvaro yaṣānte akākuśrāvakaśnigdhakaṇṭhāḥ
msItem.explicit:
77r
tvādvākyārthahetukaṃ kāvyaliṅgamalaṃkāraḥ vāsanikāvṛttaṃ … 87 bhīṣmeti yeneṣṭaṃ rājasūyenamaṇḍalasyeśvaraśca yaḥ śāsti yaścājñayā rā 77r
jñassa samrāḍityamaraḥ samrājo bhāvassāmrājyaṃ tadevaśrīstāmadhigacchatā

msItem.title: Dayāśatakavyākhyā
msItem.incipit:
1r
śrīmadevaṃkaṭanāthāryyapadaṃ vandyamupāsmahe . tat vedāntamīmāṃsāniṣṇātaṃ yasya mānasaṃ . vādhūlaśrīnivāsāryapadāñja 1r
rajase namaḥ ..
msItem.explicit:
38v
doṣodbhāvanāśravaṇārthaṃ dayayaiva kāritamevañca doṣodbhāvanaśravaṇaṃ vidhānakṣamiti aiva kathaṃ doṣodbhāvavanaṃ kṣā 38v
ryyaṃtīti tānpaśyamīti (saṃyamana vadyaṃ ?) kavitārkkikasīmhāyyakṛpayā kṛtinā kṛtā vādhūlaśrīnivāsena dayāśatakaṭīkikā kathaṃ mayāvaseyā (lacuna 2 akzaras)
msItem.finalRubric:
38v
kavitārkikasīnhavāk tadā vimuhya saṃkalpalubdhagrāhyatviyaṃ budhaiḥ iti vādhūlaśrīnivāsasya kṛtiḥ kṛpāśatakaṭīkikā saṃpurṇā

msItem.title: Raṃgastutivyākhyā
msItem.incipit: 1rśrīmadvādhūladāśarathaye namaḥ paśyan godāvarimagre prāṅgamukhaḥ padmakāsanaḥ narasiṃhavapurviṣṇurasya dharmapure vasat veṃkaṭācārya varyasya caraṇau śaraṇaṃ vṛṇe
msItem.explicit:
129v
samīpe iti atra pūrvamayodhyāyāssarayutīre śrīraṃganāthasya rāmacandrasītāmabhipretyoktamiti mantavyaṃ kāverītīre tadarccanā saṃbhavāditi 124

msItem.title: Hayagrīvastotravyākhyā
msItem.rubric:
[IV-
] 1 śrīmānveṃkaṭanāthāryyaḥ kavitārkikakesarī vedāntacāryyavaryyo me sannidhattāṃ sadā hṛdi ||
msItem.finalRubric:
[IV-
kavitārkika simhāya kalyāṇaguṇaśāline śrīmate veṃkaṭeśāya [IV-
vedāntagurave namaḥ hayagrīvastotravyākhyāsaṃpūrṇā

support.p: Wooden thick guard folio. Kaya is written in Devanagari script in pencil in the left side of the guard folio. Some scratches on the right side of the guard folio.

extent.measure: 1 guard folios, 3 blank folios, 142 written folios and also folio 27 is blank.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numbering. Every texts begins with the separate numbering but for the third text the last folio is numbered as 130, this shows the continuation of numbering from the first text of the manuscript. Folio 27 is blank and26rhas only one line written and the rest of the folio is blank.
supportDesc.condition: The folio has worm holes and broken edges.

handNote.desc: Readable. Some letters are so mixed with other following that it is difficult to read.

additions.desc:
Titles of the texts are mentioned on the first folio of the text and shortforms are mentioned irregularly in the left margin of the following folios. da is written on some folio in the left margin of the verso. raṃ is written in the left margin from II-
-
. ha is written in the left margin from VI-
--
.
hariḥ om is written in the left margin of with the title of the every text in this manuscript.
Number 19 is written on the front and back side of the guard folio in pink pencil.

origin.origDate: The colophon at the end of the text 3 Raṃgastutivyākhyā the manuscript is written between 1922-23 in the month of āṣāḍha or according to tamil calendar āni which is according to Gregorian Calendar is mid June to mid July.

listBibl.bibl: Shishupal Vadh Of Magh With Commentary Of Mallinath, edi. Durga Prasad, 1923 : Nirnay Sagar Press.

encodingDesc.p: As the folio numbering begins with 1 for each text to avoid conflict text numbers are added with the folio numbers. From the second text onwards the first folio is not numbered. Numbering begins with 2 so have supplied folio number 1.
